intro: Anemone sulphurea, commonly known as the sulphur anemone, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes many showy and often toxic plants. The plant features delicate, yellowish-white flowers with five petals, typically blooming in early spring. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in a fine layer of silky hairs. Anemone sulphurea thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky areas.
